version_description: Every couple weeks we roll out updates that make Textfree a better place to chat. Get the latest version for the best Textfree experience. If you’re enjoying your free phone number, please consider reviewing our app.

We never stop working to make your Textfree experience better. It’s pretty much all we do. For the past couple weeks, we worked to make the app faster and more reliable for you. And gosh darn it, that’s what we’re gonna keep doing.

If you’re enjoying our app, feel free to leave us a review. Good or bad, we love reading them and any feedback helps us make Textfree better for everyone. Thanks.

This one's a biggy! In this update, we're rolling out a new and simplified user interface.

The streamlined navigation makes it easier to get around and gives you a more seamless texting and calling experience. On top of that, many more subtle design tweaks make Textfree easier on the eyes.

If you're enjoying Textfree, consider reviewing our app. We'd love to hear from you.

In this release, our developers have prepared for you an exquisite blend of enhancements. To start, you’ll enjoy a hearty portion of our hand-coded reliability improvements. Next, you’ll experience a sumptuous duo of grass-fed bug fixes served with a side of artisanal stability updates. And finally, a decadent helping of performance upgrades that were handpicked by our team of engineers.

You hear a lot about "bugs" in these things. Well, we don't like bugs either. What we do like is making Textfree better.  This release includes a bug fix that new message screen should display the already existing conversation items.

We’re always listening to your feedback to improve Textfree. In addition to regular performance improvements, this release cleans up your voicemail controls so they’re easier to use.  If you’re enjoying the app, consider leaving us a rating or review.

Each Textfree update makes it better, faster, and more reliable. Other noteworthy highlights from this release include:

• Fixed a Voicemail to Text issue that prevented some transcriptions from appearing properly. You can now read your voicemails (and see who recorded it) as expected.

• Improved your conversation view to clearly indicate the specific number of a given contact (Home, Mobile, Work, etc).

• Made some minor design and layout tweaks to keep things tidy throughout the app.

• Made some minor design and layout tweaks to keep things tidy throughout the app.

• Fixed an issue when searching for a contact by typing a few numbers, not all the matches in your address book showed up.
On top of regular performance improvements, we fixed an issue that caused deleted voicemail transcriptions to reappear.

Every couple weeks we roll out updates that make Textfree a better place to chat.

This time around, we fixed an issue that prevented media in your device's photo album from being sharable on Textfree.
On top of regular performance updates, we improved how message previews are displayed. You can now see the contact name in your notifications, even when you have the message preview turned off

n addition to regular improvements, we fixed a couple display issues some iPhone X and iPhone 6/7 Plus users were experiencing. These fixes make your picture message and Inbox viewing consistent with other phone sizes.

We recently made some improvements to Textfree that make more of your communication history accessible. That means your inbox now populates more messages, calls, and voicemails than before.

This release helps fix some of the performance issues and sluggishness associated with your newfound inbox capacity. If you’re enjoying Textfree, please leave us a rating or review.
